titles.en: Chapter 56 – Regarding the one who does not intend the Tamatto
Chapter 56 – Regarding the one who does not intend the Tamatto

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ رَجُلٍ لَبَّى بِالْحَجِّ مُفْرِداً فَقَدِمَ مَكَّةَ وَ طَافَ بِالْبَيْتِ وَ صَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ عِنْدَ مَقَامِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) وَ سَعَى بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ قَالَ فَلْيَحِلَّ وَ لْيَجْعَلْهَا مُتْعَةً إِلَّا أَنْ يَكُونَ سَاقَ الْهَدْيَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Ammar who said, ‘I asked Abu Abdullahasws about a man who exclaimed Talbiyya with the exclusive Hajj. He proceeded to Makkah and circumambulated with the House (Kabah), and Prayed two Cycles by the Standing Place of Ibrahimas, and performed Sa’ee between Al-Safa and Al-Marwa’. Heasws said: ‘So let him be free (from Ihraam), and let him make it to be a Tamatto, unless if he happens to be ushering the sacrificial animal’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَنْ طَافَ بِالْبَيْتِ وَ بِالصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ أَحَلَّ أَحَبَّ أَوْ كَرِهَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Bin Fazzal, from Ibn Bukeyr, from Zurara who said, ‘I heard Abu Ja’farasws saying: ‘The one who circumambulates with the House (Kabah), and with Al-Safa and Al-Marwa, is free (from Ihraam), whether he likes it or not’.

verses.text: أَحْمَدُ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا طَافَ بَيْنَ هَذَيْنِ الْحَجَرَيْنِ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ أَحَدٌ إِلَّا أَحَلَّ إِلَّا سَائِقَ الْهَدْيِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ahmad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub, from the one who informed him, (It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassanasws having said: ‘Whoever performs Tawaaf (circumambulation) between the two stones, Al-Safa and Al-Marwa, would be out of the state of (from Ihraam), unless he is ushering the sacrificial animal’.
